C++ API Reference

This section documents the C++ code under src/cpp/.

class alw_transducer : public CPSGrader::timed_unary_transducer
#include <transducer.h>

Public Functions

inline explicit alw_transducer(interval *_I, transducer *_child)
inline virtual alw_transducer *clone() const
inline virtual ~alw_transducer()
virtual double compute_robustness()
virtual double compute_lower_rob()
virtual double compute_upper_rob()
virtual double causation_opt_upper()

Computes the upper bound causation optimization for ALWAYS transducer. This method evaluates the causation optimization for the always operator over a time interval [a,b].

Returns:

The upper bound causation value for the ALWAYS operation

virtual double causation_opt_lower()

Computes the lower bound causation optimization for ALWAYS transducer. This method evaluates the causation optimization for the always operator over a time interval [a,b]. It combines causation and robustness values.

Returns:

The lower bound causation value for the ALWAYS operation

inline virtual void set_duration()
inline virtual void print() const
inline virtual void print(ostream &os) const

Public Members

Signal cauM
Signal zM
class and_transducer : public CPSGrader::binary_transducer
#include <transducer.h>

Public Functions

inline explicit and_transducer(transducer *_childL, transducer *_childR)
inline virtual and_transducer *clone() const
inline virtual ~and_transducer()
virtual double compute_robustness()
virtual double compute_lower_rob()
virtual double compute_upper_rob()
virtual double causation_opt_upper()

Computes the upper bound causation optimization for AND transducer. This method evaluates the causation optimization by computing the upper bound for both child transducers and combining them using AND logic.

Returns:

The upper bound causation value for the AND operation

virtual double causation_opt_lower()

Computes the lower bound causation optimization for AND transducer. This method evaluates the causation optimization by computing the lower bound for both child transducers and combining them using AND logic. The result is the maximum of two possible combinations to ensure soundness.

Returns:

The lower bound causation value for the AND operation

inline virtual void set_duration()
inline virtual void print() const
inline virtual void print(ostream &os) const

Public Members

Signal cau_lowL
Signal cau_lowR

class not_transducer : public CPSGrader::unary_transducer
#include <transducer.h>

inline virtual not_transducer *clone() const
inline ~not_transducer()
virtual double compute_robustness()
virtual double compute_lower_rob()
virtual double compute_upper_rob()
virtual double causation_opt_upper()

Computes the upper bound causation optimization for NOT transducer. This method evaluates the causation optimization by computing the lower bound of the child transducer and negating it.

Returns:

The upper bound causation value for the NOT operation

virtual double causation_opt_lower()

Computes the lower bound causation optimization for NOT transducer. This method evaluates the causation optimization by computing the upper bound of the child transducer and negating it.

Returns:

The lower bound causation value for the NOT operation

inline virtual void set_duration()
inline virtual void print() const
inline virtual void print(ostream &os) const
class or_transducer : public CPSGrader::binary_transducer
#include <transducer.h>

Public Functions

inline explicit or_transducer(transducer *_childL, transducer *_childR)
inline virtual or_transducer *clone() const
inline virtual ~or_transducer()
virtual double compute_robustness()
virtual double compute_lower_rob()
virtual double compute_upper_rob()
virtual double causation_opt_upper()

Computes the upper bound causation optimization for OR transducer. This method evaluates the causation optimization by computing the upper bound for both child transducers and combining them using OR logic. The result is the minimum of two possible combinations to ensure soundness.

Returns:

The upper bound causation value for the OR operation

virtual double causation_opt_lower()

Computes the lower bound causation optimization for OR transducer. This method evaluates the causation optimization by computing the lower bound for both child transducers and combining them using OR logic.

Returns:

The lower bound causation value for the OR operation

inline virtual void set_duration()
inline virtual void print() const
inline virtual void print(ostream &os) const

Signal cau_upR

void compute_not(const Signal&)

Signal becomes neg of signal argument.

Robustness computation functions - all these methods first clear content

void compute_and(const Signal&, const Signal&)

Signal becomes conjunction (min) of the two arguments.

void compute_or(const Signal&, const Signal&)

Signal becomes disjunction (max) of the two arguments.

void compute_implies(const Signal&, const Signal&)

Signal becomes implication (max of not x and y) of the two arguments.

void compute_eventually(const Signal&)

Signal becomes robust eventually of argument.

void compute_bounded_eventually(const Signal&, double)

ev_[0, a)

void compute_timed_eventually(const Signal&, double, double)

ev_[a,b]

void compute_globally(const Signal&)

Signal becomes robust globally of argument.

void compute_bounded_globally(const Signal&, double)

alw_[0, a)

void compute_timed_globally(const Signal&, double, double)

alw_[a,b]

void compute_until(const Signal&, const Signal&)

Signal becomes robust untimed until.

void compute_timed_until(const Signal&, const Signal&, double, double)

until_[a,b]

void compute_plateau_max(const Signal&, double)

computes max lemire window of size a of argument signal

TODO Auxiliary routines (should be privatized probably)

class stl_atom : public CPSGrader::binary_transducer
#include <transducer.h>

Public Functions

inline stl_atom(transducer *_childL, string cp, transducer *_childR)
inline virtual stl_atom *clone() const
inline ~stl_atom()
virtual double compute_robustness()
virtual double causation_opt_upper()

Computes the upper bound causation optimization for STL atomic predicate. This method evaluates the causation optimization for atomic predicates by comparing signal values at the end of the trace.

Returns:

The upper bound causation value for the atomic predicate

virtual double causation_opt_lower()

Computes the lower bound causation optimization for STL atomic predicate. This method evaluates the causation optimization for atomic predicates by comparing signal values at the end of the trace.

Returns:

The lower bound causation value for the atomic predicate

file stl_causation_opt.cpp
#include mex.h
#include <string>
#include <iostream>
#include <sstream>
#include stl_driver.h

MEX interface for optimized STL causation monitoring.

This file provides a MATLAB MEX interface for optimized online STL monitoring with causation analysis. It is an optimized version of stl_causation.cpp that uses the causation_opt_upper() and causation_opt_lower() methods for more efficient computation of robustness bounds in causation analysis.

The MEX function accepts:

  • Signal names

  • STL formula as string

  • Data array

  • Time interval

And returns:

  • Upper bound robustness values (optimized causation)

  • Lower bound robustness values (optimized causation)

Key differences from stl_causation.cpp:

  • Uses causation_opt_upper/lower instead of compute_qnmono_upper/lower

  • More efficient computation for causation analysis

  • Optimized for real-time monitoring scenarios

Author

CPSGrader Team

Date

2023

Functions

void mexFunction(int nlhs, mxArray *plhs[], int nrhs, const mxArray *prhs[])

MEX function entry point for optimized STL causation monitoring.

This is the main entry point for the optimized MATLAB MEX interface. It processes input arguments, parses the STL formula, and computes optimized robustness bounds for online monitoring with causation analysis using the most efficient algorithms.

Parameters:

  • nlhs Number of left-hand side arguments (outputs)

  • plhs Array of left-hand side arguments (outputs)

  • nrhs Number of right-hand side arguments (inputs)

  • prhs Array of right-hand side arguments (inputs)

file stl_eval_mex_pw.cpp

#include <iostream>
#include <sstream>
